core_definition.goal: Retain and expand through proactive engagement
core_definition.pain: Doesn't know problems until too late, action items fall through cracks at scale
core_definition.success: Catches risk signals early, smooth handoffs, QBRs prepared automatically

tech_literacy.note: CSMs are more technical than originally modeled - they ask about APIs and webhooks

typical_pain_points: 100+ accounts means action items fall through cracks after 25 conversations
Context switching between tools (CRM, chat, email, docs)
Handoff from sales lacks context on promises made
QBR prep requires manual synthesis of internal + external data
Can't resurface the right CTA at the right time
Renewal conversations feel reactive, not strategic
Health scores don't reflect actual sentiment from calls
Team has to re-watch videos or read notes to update CRM
typical_fears: AI will miss the emotional nuance in customer conversations
Automated outreach will feel impersonal and damage relationship
Will lose my 'ear to the ground' advantage
Tool will surface false positives and waste my time
AI will log wrong info, making me look bad
typical_voice_quotes: I have 100 ish accounts that I'm responsible for. So today, that CTA is very front of mind for me. After I have 25 more customer conversations, it may not be.
I'm an account manager under the CS organization. AM is sort of the foot in both camps, but I am looking at this more from a CS lens.
The more that I can create in HubSpot, the better. Like, if I could create an upsell deal.
Tell me what AskElephant would do to help me resurface that at the right time.
I can tell when a customer is unhappy before any metric shows it
If I had known they said that in the sales call, I would have handled onboarding differently

behavioral_patterns.first_click_tendency: Looks for customer-specific context, history, recent activity
behavioral_patterns.error_response: Documents issue, works around it, flags to team
behavioral_patterns.help_seeking: Searches knowledge base, then asks team channel
behavioral_patterns.abandonment_trigger: Tool creates more work than it saves
behavioral_patterns.evaluation_style: Systematic, comparing 4-5 vendors with structured criteria

technical_interest.note: Higher than typical CSM persona - asks about APIs, webhooks, integrations
indicators: Do you guys have an API?
Are you working any technical or service solutions around integrating with products?
I'm already using ChatGPT company knowledge feature

real_customer_examples.name: AJ Hoke
real_customer_examples.quote: After I have 25 more customer conversations, it may not be front of mind
